metadata.synopsis: Confrontation with Eltan noble if Ravengard died and Florrick is dead or still in prison. Wyll is not with party in this version
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Kill Ravengard and Counsellor Florrick;- Send Wyll to camp- Go to 33; 35; -41;OR- Use origin debug book to go to Wyll's Act3 moments;- Florrick Confrontation;

8.speaker: Cordula Eltan
8.text: You. The gods-damned disease of the Gate.
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick appears with a cadre of allies from the upper city - patriars and their guards.

79.speaker: Cordula Eltan
79.text: Lady Mizora told me everything. How you and the Blade of Frontiers slaughtered his own father, how he craves ultimate power.
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

33.speaker: Cordula Eltan
33.text: How he means to make the city bow to him and him alone.
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

19.speaker: Cordula Eltan
19.text: First I finish you. Then I finish the duke's traitorous son.
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

71.text: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: The Blade has saved countless lives. He is still the man you thought he was.
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Ravengard could still be alive. And we intend to save him.
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

11.speaker: Cordula Eltan
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

38.text: I believe you, the Battle Lord help me.

51.speaker: Cordula Eltan
51.text: I believe you, the Battle Lord help me.

21.speaker: Cordula Eltan
21.text: What darkness has fallen upon us.

68.speaker: Cordula Eltan
68.text: Listen, there's something Wyll should know. On his way from Elturel, Ravengard sent a messenger with word of the cult.

70.speaker: Cordula Eltan
70.text: He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but he realised the danger before anyone else did.

31.speaker: Cordula Eltan
31.text: He understood that if the cult were successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.

40.speaker: Cordula Eltan
40.text: And he knew that to protect the city, one trained in the ways of the great champions would have to rouse the wyrm living beneath. If I'm not mistaken, that would be Wyll.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Do you mean there's a dragon living under the city?

7.speaker: Cordula Eltan
7.text: A bronze dragon, to be precise, sleeping beneath us.

27.speaker: Cordula Eltan
27.text: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.

54.speaker: Cordula Eltan
54.text: He made Balduran a binding promise to protect the city when its need was greatest.

46.speaker: Cordula Eltan
46.text: The city's survived countless threats. But Ravengard knew its walls would fall to the cult.

28.speaker: Cordula Eltan
28.text: With him gone and the city near ruin, your call is to unleash the Heart of the Gate.

58.speaker: Cordula Eltan
58.text: Take this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.

23.speaker: Cordula Eltan
23.text: Follow its path to the wyrm. Or do not, and let the Coast be drowned in blood.

61.speaker: Cordula Eltan
61.text: We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek more allies to help our cause.

60.speaker: Cordula Eltan
60.text: Dead? Blast - not what I wanted to hear.

34.speaker: Cordula Eltan
34.text: The fate of the city now rests with us.

62.speaker: Cordula Eltan
62.text: May Helm help us drive the Absolute from the Coast.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Your faith in us is well-founded. We will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

30.speaker: Cordula Eltan
30.text: I was right to lay down my arms, Foehammer be praised.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.

24.speaker: Cordula Eltan
24.text: Not a fairy tale, but a history, told far and wide by Balduran himself.

55.speaker: Cordula Eltan
55.text: I should go, gather allies. We'll join you in your hour of need.

17.speaker: Cordula Eltan
17.text: Free the wyrm, and may his thunderous wind drive the Absolute from the Coast.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Let the dragon sleep. We'll deal with the Absolute on our own terms.

0.speaker: Cordula Eltan
0.text: Even Baldur's Gate's greatest warrior knew one blade alone cannot rout an army.

69.speaker: Cordula Eltan
69.text: Ravengard was that warrior. If his legacy is to live, you must release the wyrm.

65.speaker: Cordula Eltan
65.text: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.

50.speaker: Cordula Eltan
50.text: Find it, and follow its path to the wyrm. Or do not, and let the Coast be drowned in blood.

13.speaker: Cordula Eltan
13.text: It is said that only a true champion can awaken the Wyrm. Now that the Grand Duke has fallen, the duty falls to his son.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: The city has found its protector, thank you very much. Me.

45.speaker: Cordula Eltan
45.text: Only a true champion can awaken the wyrm. As the Blade of Frontiers, Wyll has proven his worth. Please, give him this message.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Ravengard's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing we could do.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Mizora lied to you. We tried to save Ravengard, and she sabotaged us.

12.speaker: Cordula Eltan
12.text: Pitiful, how easy the lies come to you.

14.text: Pitiful, how easy the lies come to you.

20.speaker: Cordula Eltan
20.text: Pitiful, how easy the lies come to you.

76.speaker: Cordula Eltan
76.text: You killed the best of Baldur's Gate. May the Hells make you suffer.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: A relevant thread of knowledge pokes at your mind. Explore it.

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*

48.speaker: Cordula Eltan
48.text: The Blade of Frontiers, nothing but a cold-blooded killer. I will make him and his allies pay for his father's death.

15.speaker: Cordula Eltan
15.text: The Blade of Frontiers, nothing but a cold-blooded killer. I will make him and his allies pay for his father's death.

3.text: I will not play your mind games. To arms!

49.speaker: Cordula Eltan
49.text: I will not play your mind games. To arms!

5.speaker: Cordula Eltan
5.text: I am Cordula Eltan, heir to the hero who forged the Fist.

59.speaker: Cordula Eltan
59.text: And you are the Hells' lowest dregs. I will not let Wyll take the city!

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Cordula Eltan. Your family has a storied history in this city.

6.speaker: Cordula Eltan
6.text: My great grandfather built the Fist and forged its first blades.

43.speaker: Cordula Eltan
43.text: A man of honour - much like Wyll's father. How cold is your heart, that you'd be his butcher?

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Attack us, then. Let's see who's left standing.
